briefdescription.para: AT command error handler callback function.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* lwm2m_os_sms_callback_t) (struct lwm2m_os_sms_data *const data, void *context)
memberdef.name: lwm2m_os_sms_callback_t

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* lwm2m_os_pdn_event_handler_t) (uint8_t cid, enum lwm2m_os_pdn_event event, int reason)
memberdef.argsstring: )(uint8_t cid, enum lwm2m_os_pdn_event event, int reason)
memberdef.name: lwm2m_os_pdn_event_handler_t

detaileddescription.para: If assigned during PDP context creation, the event handler will receive status information relative to the Packet Data Network connection, as reported by the AT notifications CNEC and GGEV.
This handler is executed by the same context that dispatches AT notifications.

briefdescription.para: Create a Packet Data Protocol (PDP) context.

detaileddescription.para: If a callback is provided via the cb parameter, generate events from the CNEC and GGEV AT notifications to report state of the Packet Data Network (PDN) connection.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the new PDP context.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t cid, const char *apn, enum lwm2m_os_pdn_fam family)
memberdef.name: lwm2m_os_pdn_ctx_configure

briefdescription.para: Configure a Packet Data Protocol context.

parameterdescription.para: The Access Point Name to configure the PDP context with.
The family to configure the PDN context for.

briefdescription.para: Destroy a Packet Data Protocol context.
Activate a Packet Data Network (PDN) connection.

parameterdescription.para: The PDP context ID to activate a connection for.
If provided, the function will block to return the ESM error reason.
If provided, the function will block to return PDN_FAM_IPV4 if only IPv4 is supported, or PDN_FAM_IPV6 if only IPv6 is supported. Otherwise, this value will remain unchanged.

briefdescription.para: Deactivate a Packet Data Network (PDN) connection.
Retrieve the PDN ID for a given PDP Context.

detaileddescription.para: The PDN ID can be used to route traffic through a Packet Data Network.

parameterdescription.para: The context ID of the PDN connection.

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the default Access Point Name (APN).

detaileddescription.para: The default APN is the APN of the default PDP context (zero).

parameterdescription.para: The buffer to copy the APN into.
The size of the output buffer.

briefdescription.para: Set a callback for events pertaining to the default PDP context (zero).

memberdef.argsstring: (lwm2m_os_sem_t **sem, unsigned int initial_count, unsigned int limit)
memberdef.name: lwm2m_os_sem_init

parameterdescription.para: Address of the pointer to the semaphore.
Timeout in ms or -1 for forever.

briefdescription.para: Put a thread to a sleep.
Read an entry from non-volatile storage.
Write an entry to non-volatile storage.
Reserve a timer task from the OS.

parameterdescription.para: Function to run for this task.

briefdescription.para: Start a timer on system work queue.

parameterdescription.para: Delay before submitting the task in ms.
Work placed on queue, already on queue or already running.

briefdescription.para: Start a timer on a specific queue.

parameterdescription.para: Delay before submitting the task in ms.
Work placed on queue, already on queue or already running.

briefdescription.para: Obtain the time remaining on a timer.
Check if a timer task is pending.

parameterdescription.para: If a timer task is pending.

briefdescription.para: Create and start a new thread.

simplesect.para: A positive number nrf_modem_dfu in case of modem firmware update.

parameterdescription.para: If AT command driver initialization failed.
If unable to register as SMS listener.

briefdescription.para: Establish a connection with the server.
Retrieve size of file being downloaded.

parameterdescription.para: Size of the file being downloaded.

briefdescription.para: get enabled system modes from modem.

parameterdescription.para: Array to store the enabled modes. LWM2M_OS_LTE_MODE_CAT_M1 Cat-M1 (LTE-FDD) LWM2M_OS_LTE_MODE_CAT_NB1 Cat-NB1 (NB-IoT)
LWM2M_OS_LTE_MODE_NONE for no preference LWM2M_OS_LTE_MODE_CAT_M1 for Cat-M1 (LTE-FDD) LWM2M_OS_LTE_MODE_CAT_NB1 for Cat-NB1 (NB-IoT)
Estimate of the new firmware image to be received. May be greater than or equal to the actual image size received by the end.
Ready to start a new firmware upgrade.

simplesect.para: A positive number of bytes written so far, if the previous upgrade was not completed. In this case, the upgrade will resume from this offset.

parameterdescription.para: Another application firmware upgrade is already ongoing.
Not enough memory to store the file of the given size.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *buf, uint16_t len, uint16_t offset, uint32_t crc32)
memberdef.name: lwm2m_os_app_fota_fragment

briefdescription.para: Receive an application firmware image fragment and validate its CRC.

parameterdescription.para: Length of the fragment in bytes.
Offset into the buffer, from which to start copying the fragment to flash.
Expected IEEE CRC32 value. Must be checked for the whole fragment.
Not enough memory to store the file.
Firmware image not recognized, or this function is not implemented.

briefdescription.para: Finalize the current application firmware upgrade and CRC-validate the image.

parameterdescription.para: Expected IEEE CRC32 value. Should be checked for the whole file in flash.

briefdescription.para: Abort the current application firmware upgrade.
Maximum number of work queues that the system must support.
Maximum number of timers that the system must support.
Maximum number of threads that the system must support.
Maximum number of semaphores that the system must support.
Range of the non-volatile storage identifiers used by the library.
